medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain began one week prior to presentation with no known inciting event. It was accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and poor PO intake. The pain worsened significantly when the patient's right foot made contact with the ground. After initial improvement, the pain returned before presenting again to the ED.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diabetes type II on insulin, HLD, psoriasis, HTN, DJD of spine, asthma, R rotator cuff impingement.
